# Connecting with Opal data server
## Login to server and assign study data
```{r, echo=FALSE}
#Load R libraries
library(opal)
library(tidyverse)
# Create an opal object with the login information
erasmus_opal <- opal.login()
CLSA_cop1<- read.csv("")
CLSA_cop1<- read.csv("copfu1.csv")
CLSA_cop1[CLSA_cop1==-99999]<-NA
opal.file_download(erasmus_opal,"/home/clsa/171013_McMaster_PRaina _CoP4_Baseline.csv","/home/agurer/lifestyle_behaviours/cop01.csv")
CLSA_cop01<-read.csv("cop01.csv",na.strings = "",strip.white=TRUE)

```
## Assign participant id as first column of your harmonized dataframes
```{r, echo=FALSE}
lsb_CLSA_0 <- data.frame(id = CLSA_cop01$entity_id)
lsb_CLSA_1 <- data.frame(id = CLSA_cop1$entity_id)

```
## When you are done with your work, logout of Opal server
```{r, echo=FALSE}
opal.logout(erasmus_opal) 
```

# Alcohol consumption subdomain

### **Variable label**:  Current consumption of alcohol  
**Variable name**: lsb_alc_cur_0  
**Variable description**:  Indicator of whether the participant currently consumes alcohol or has consumed alcohol in the past 12 months.  
**Value type**: integer  
**Variable unit**: N/A  
**Category coding**:  

**Code** | **Category Label**  
------------- | -------------  
0 |  Does not currently consume alcohol   
1 |  Currently consumes alcohol  

**Harmonization status**:  complete  
**Harmonization comment**:   
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
lsb_CLSA_0$lsb_alc_cur_0<-recode(as.character(CLSA_cop1$ALC_FREQ_COM), "1"=1L ,"2"=1L ,"3"=1L ,"4"=1L ,"5"=1L ,"6"=1L ,"96"=0L, .default =NA_integer_)
```  

### **Variable label**:   Frequency of binge drinking  
**Variable name**: lsb_alc_binge_0  
**Variable description**:  Frequency of drinking 4 or more drinks in one day.  
**Value type**: integer  
**Variable unit**: N/A  
**Category coding**:  

**Code** | **Category Label**  
------------- | -------------  
1 |  0 to 3 times a month  
2 |  1 to 2 times a week   
3 |  3 times a week or more  

**Harmonization status**:  
**Harmonization comment**:   
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
#This is where the R-script will be written
lsb_CLSA_0$lsb_alc_binge0<-ifelse(CLSA_cop0$ALC_MLFQ_COM==1|CLSA_cop0$ALC_MLFQ_COM==2|CLSA_cop0$ALC_MLFQ_COM==3|CLSA_cop0$ALC_FMFQ_COM==1|CLSA_cop0$ALC_FMFQ_COM==2|CLSA_cop0$ALC_FMFQ_COM==3,3L,ifelse(CLSA_cop0$ALC_MLFQ_COM==4|CLSA_cop0$ALC_FMFQ_COM==4, 2L,ifelse(CLSA_cop0$ALC_MLFQ_COM==5|CLSA_cop0$ALC_MLFQ_COM==6|CLSA_cop0$ALC_MLFQ_COM==7|CLSA_cop0$ALC_MLFQ_COM==8|CLSA_cop0$ALC_FMFQ_COM==5|CLSA_cop0$ALC_FMFQ_COM==6|CLSA_cop0$ALC_FMFQ_COM==7|CLSA_cop0$ALC_FMFQ_COM==8,1L,NA)))

table(lsb_CLSA_1$lsb_alc_binge1, useNA="always")

```  
### **Variable label**:   Frequency of binge drinking  
**Variable name**: lsb_alc_binge_1  
**Variable description**:  Frequency of drinking 4 or more drinks in one day.  
**Value type**: integer  
**Variable unit**: N/A  
**Category coding**:  

**Code** | **Category Label**  
------------- | -------------  
1 |  0 to 3 times a month  
2 |  1 to 2 times a week   
3 |  3 times a week or more  

**Harmonization status**:  
**Harmonization comment**:   Comment about category. Also study-specific variable is 5 or more drinks 
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
#Almost every day (incl. 6 times a week), 3
#4-5 times a week, 3
#2-3 times a week, 3
#Once a week, 2
#2-3 times a month, 1
#About once a month, 1
#Less than once a month, 1
#Never, 1

lsb_CLSA_1$lsb_alc_binge1<-ifelse(CLSA_cop1$ALC_MLFQ_COF1==1:3|CLSA_cop1$ALC_FMFQ_COF1==1:3,3L,ifelse(CLSA_cop1$ALC_MLFQ_COF1==4|CLSA_cop1$ALC_FMFQ_COF1==4, 2L,ifelse(CLSA_cop1$ALC_MLFQ_COF1==5:7|CLSA_cop1$ALC_FMFQ_COF1==5:7,1L,NA)))

table(lsb_CLSA_1$lsb_alc_binge1, useNA="always")
table( CLSA_cop1$ALC_MLFQ_COF1, useNA="always")
```

**Variable unit**:  N/A

**Code** | **Category Label**  
------------- | -------------

**Harmonization status**:  complete  
**Harmonization comment**:   Ever smoking tobacco
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
#creating intermediate veriables to account for answering as Having smoked tobacco products in the previous wave. 
MyMerge <- function(x,y){
  merge(x,y, by= c("entity_id"),all=TRUE)
}
med_table <- Reduce(MyMerge, list(CLSA_cop0, CLSA_cop1))
#Harmonization scripts to create "ever had "

med_table$lsb_smk_ever_0 <-lsb_CLSA_0$lsb_smk_ever_0 
#Direct mapping to harmonized tables keeping correct participants for each wave

med_table$lsb_smk_ever_1<- ifelse(med_table$lsb_smk_ever_0 ==0 & as.integer(med_table$ICQ_SMOKE_COF1)==2&as.integer(med_table$SMK_OTOCC_COF1)==2, 0L, ifelse(med_table$lsb_smk_ever_0 ==1 | as.integer(med_table$ICQ_SMOKE_COF1)==1|as.integer(med_table$ICQ_SMOKE_COF1)==3|as.integer(med_table$SMK_OTOCC_COF1)==1,
                                                                                                                                                        1L,NA))
#Direct mapping to harmonized tables keeping correct participants for each wave
med_table$id<-med_table$entity_id
lsb_CLSA_1<-merge(lsb_CLSA_1,med_table[,c("id","lsb_smk_ever_1")],by="id",all.x=TRUE)
table(lsb_CLSA_1$lsb_smk_ever_1)
SMK_OTOCC_COF1

```
